text: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Introduction. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds, and peace and blessings be upon our Prophet Muhammad, and upon all his family and companions. To proceed: The honor of every science is by the honor of its subject matter, and its rank rises according to the need for it, and the effects of its benefit on creation show its virtue over others. Among the most majestic sciences in worth and greatest in benefit is: "The Science of Hadith", for by it Allah preserved the Sunnah of His Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. Among the means of His, the Exalted, preservation of it is: harnessing firmly grounded scholars to classify in the sciences of Hadith, ranging from lengthy to brief. Among those is: Al-Hafiz Ahmad bin Ali Ibn Hajar, may Allah have mercy on him. He gathered in his book: "Nukhbat al-Fikar fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar" what was scattered, summarized in it the sciences of those who preceded, and added to it unique points and benefits, with precision in induction, probing, and division. So his compilation came as a concise, comprehensive selection received by the people of knowledge with acceptance. Therefore, I worked on investigating it within the series of investigating additional texts from "Student of Knowledge Texts", relying in that on precious manuscripts, so it appears in the most beautiful attire as the author put it. I have established in the footnotes of this copy the differences between the manuscript copies and other things, and I have singled out another copy stripped of that.

text: My Methodology in Investigation. 1 - I symbolized the copies with alphabetical letters according to their date; oldest to newest. 2 - I established in the text what most copies agreed upon, and perhaps I established what appeared in some of them or one of them if consideration required that, and I explain the reason mostly. 3 - I established in the footnotes the important differences between the copies. 4 - I sought help by reviewing Nuzhat al-Nazar and its explanations in weighing between some differences contained in the text copies. 5 - I mostly neglected mentioning what the scribes inadvertently erred in, which is of the nature of pure mistakes, especially what was of the nature of error in diacritics (dabt); unless this error has a possible face, then I establish it. 6 - The author, may Allah have mercy on him, merged in "Nuzhat al-Nazar" the words of Al-Nukhba with the words of the explanation to be more fitting - as he stated -. This necessitated that the diacritics of some of its words differ between the text and its explanation; due to the change of context, and the consequent difference in parsing. Mulla Ali al-Qari alerted to this by saying - in Sharh Sharh Nukhbat al-Fikar (p. 151) -: "It became frequent in this book...

text: ...considering its mixing: that he made a term parsed with one parsing in the text, and another parsing in the explanation, and the likes of that." Therefore, I neglected the differences of this kind, and restricted myself to considering the diacritics contained in the text copies; unless the context of the text did not change in the explanation. 7 - I established the text according to what became famous of contemporary spelling rules, and did not point out the difference of copies in that; such as the method of writing Hamzas, drawing Ta' as open or tied (Marbuta), and the like. 8 - If the difference is by advancing a word over a word; I mention the difference only in the footnote, and say after it: "with advancement and delay". 9 - If the copies differed in the diacritics of a word; I establish in the text the most correct and famous face, and indicate in the footnote the rest of the faces, with an explanation of the weighing from the scholars' words mostly. 10 - If a word was written in one of the copies with two faces in one letter - like: Ta' and Ya', or Nun and Ya' and the like -; I write in the footnote what agrees with the text, then I clarify that it is with both letters together. 11 - The symbols contained in the margins of the copies, I did not establish them as they are with their symbol, but wrote them with the intended word - for example the letter: "Kh, Kh-" intended by it: reference to another copy -; I wrote it like this: "in a copy on the margin so-and-so".

text: 12 - If a word was diacritized in some copies and neglected in the rest, with no difference between the diacritized copies, I establish the existing diacritics without pointing to the neglected copies. If the copies differed in diacritics, I indicate what is in the diacritized copies, and neglect mentioning the non-diacritized copies. 13 - I observed in describing the difference in word diacritics: distinguishing the sign of construction (Bina') and what goes back to the morphological structure of the word; from the signs of parsing (I'rab). 14 - I made two copies for the book: A - The first copy: It is the copy containing the investigation footnotes; from differences between copies, weighing between them, and commenting on what needs comment, and it is this copy. text: Description of the Copies Relied Upon in Investigating the Text. I relied in investigating the text of "Nukhbat al-Fikar" on eight manuscripts, whose copying is early. I also compared the text with eight ancient copies of its explanation "Nuzhat al-Nazar", and I did not establish the differences between the copies of Al-Nuzhah, except in some important places where need called for it. These copies according to the date of their copying are as follows: First: Copies of "Nukhbat al-Fikar". The First Copy, symbolized by (A): It is a manuscript preserved in the National Library in Paris - France -, under number (760/1). Number of its plates: (3) plates. Date of its copying: (13) Dhu al-Hijjah, year (821 AH). Its scribe: Not mentioned. Its script: Beautiful Naskhi. text: Name of the Book. The author, may Allah have mercy on him, stated the name of his book with a clear text, which is the name agreed upon by most manuscripts, and appearing in most licenses, seals, explanations, biographical books, catalogs, and the like of places to know the book's name. Therefore, I adopted it, which is: "Nukhbat al-Fikar fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar". He, may Allah have mercy on him, stated the book's name in the introduction of his book: "Nuzhat al-Nazar fi Tawdih Nukhbat al-Fikar"; saying: "Some brothers asked me to summarize for them the important (aspects) of that; so I summarized it in nice papers, I named it: Nukhbat al-Fikar fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar." (1).

text: Biography of Al-Hafiz Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani, may Allah have mercy on him (1). His Name and Lineage: Abu al-Fadl Shihab al-Din, Ahmad bin Ali bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Ali bin Mahmoud Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani, al-Masri, al-Shafi'i. His Birth: He was born in Sha'ban, year seven hundred and seventy-three (773 AH) in Egypt. He grew up there as an orphan, memorizing the Quran, Al-Umdah, Alfiyyat al-Iraqi, Al-Hawi Al-Saghir, Mukhtasar Ibn al-Hajib, and others, while he was nine years old. His Travels and Most Famous Sheikhs: He, may Allah have mercy on him, traveled much seeking knowledge, spending his time and money for it. He traveled within Egypt, taking from its senior Sheikhs, and also traveled to the lands of Hijaz, Yemen, Sham, Aleppo, and others.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikar fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Among his most prominent Sheikhs: - Ibrahim al-Tanukhi (800 AH). - Burhan al-Din al-Abnasi (802 AH). - Ibn al-Mulaqqin (804 AH). - Siraj al-Din al-Bulqini (805 AH). - Abd al-Rahim al-Iraqi (806 AH). - Nur al-Din al-Haythami (807 AH). - Muhammad bin Ya'qub al-Fayruzabadi (817 AH). - Izz al-Din Ibn Jama'ah (819 AH). book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikar fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Scholars' Praise of Him: - Al-Hafiz Al-Iraqi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "The scholar Sheikh, the perfect virtuous one, the Imam Muhaddith, the beneficial glorifier, the precise Hafiz, the controller, the trustworthy, the safe." (1). - Muhammad Al-Fasi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "He is the most memorizing of the people of the age for hadiths and traditions (Athar), and names of narrators; the earlier and later among them, and the high and low of that, with strong knowledge of hadith defects, and good excellence in Fiqh and other things." (2). - Ibn Nasir al-Din, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "A Muhaddith Hafiz." (3). - Ibn Fahd, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "The Allama Imam, Hafiz, unique of the time, pride of the age, remnant of Huffaz, banner of the prominent Imams, support of investigators, seal of the distinguished Huffaz, and famous judges." (4). - Yusuf bin Taghri Bardi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "Sheikh al-Islam, Hafiz of the age, journey of the seekers, Mufti of sects, Commander of the Faithful in Hadith." (5). - Al-Sakhawi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "Sheikh al-Islam, and the unique of the prominent Imams, Hafiz of the age, and seal of the Mujtahids... bearer of the banner of sciences and tradition." (6).

5. Al-Manhal al-Safi (2/17). 
6. Al-Jawahir wa al-Durar (1/53).

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikar fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: - He also said: "The ancients testified to his memorization, trustworthiness, integrity, complete knowledge, burning mind, excessive intelligence, and breadth of knowledge in various arts. His Sheikh Al-Iraqi testified that he was the most knowledgeable of his companions in Hadith." (1). - Al-Hafiz Al-Suyuti, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "Unique of his time, and bearer of the banner of Sunnah in his era, the gold of this age and its pure gold, and its jewel whose pride stood firm over many ages, Imam of this art for followers, and commander of the armies of Muhaddithin, and support of existence in weakening and authenticating, and the greatest of witnesses and judges in the chapters of praise and criticism." (2). - Imam Al-Shawkani, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "He undertook spreading Hadith, and restricted himself to it in reading, teaching, and authoring, and was unique in that. The near and far, the enemy and friend testified to his memorization and precision; until applying the title 'Al-Hafiz' to him became a word of consensus." (3). His Works: They are very many; among them: - "Fath al-Bari Sharh Sahih al-Bukhari". - "Huda al-Sari Muqaddimat Fath al-Bari".

text: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar (The Choice Thought on the Terminology of the People of Tradition) by Al-Hafiz Ahmad bin Ali Ibn Hajar Al-Asqalani, may Allah have mercy on him (d. 852 AH).
foot_note: None

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful (1). Praise be to Allah, Who has never ceased to be All-Knowing, All-Powerful. May Allah send blessings upon our Master Muhammad, whom He sent (2) to (3) mankind (4) as a bringer of glad tidings and a warner, and upon his family (5)
foot_note:
1. In A: "He said - Our master and mawla, the Chief Judge, Sheikh al-Islam, Abu al-Fadl - Ahmad bin our master, the poor servant of Allah Almighty, Sheikh Nur al-Din Abu al-Hasan Ali Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani al-Shafi'i." In B: "My Lord, make easy and help, O Generous One. He said - The Sheikh, the Imam, the Allamah, the Rihla (one traveled to for knowledge), the unique of the age and the peerless of the time, Shihab al-Din - Ahmad bin Ali Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani, may Allah extend his term and dwell him in the midst of His Paradise." In C, an addition: "My Lord, make easy." In D: "My Lord, make easy, O Generous One." In E, an addition: "May Allah bless our master Muhammad and grant him abundant peace." In W, an addition: "My Lord, make easy and help. He said - The sea of benefits, our master, the Sheikh, the Imam, the Scholar, the Practitioner, the Allamah, Shihab al-Din, Abu al-Fadl - Ahmad bin Ali bin Muhammad al-Asqalani, famous as Ibn Hajar al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him and please him, and make Paradise his abode, by [the right/status of] Muhammad and his family" (a). (a) Supplicating with this formula is not legislated; Sheikh Abdul Aziz Ibn Baz, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Fatawa Nur 'ala al-Darb (2/128): "Seeking intercession (Tawassul) by the status (Jah) of the Prophet, or by the right of the Prophet, or by the status of the prophets, or by the right of the prophets, or by the status of the believers; all of this is not legislated; rather, it is an innovation (Bid'ah)." In Z, an addition: "The Book Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar. He said - Our master and our sheikh, Sheikh al-Islam, Chief Judge, Hafiz of the Age, Shihab al-Din - Ahmad al-Asqalani al-Kinani al-Shafi'i, famous by attribution as Ibn Hajar, Allah's mercy be upon him."
2. In Z: "arsala" (He sent [without pronoun]).
3. In A: From here the lacuna begins, up to his saying: "and the ranks of disparagement (Jarh)."
4. In E: "with the truth" instead of "to mankind."
5. In B, C, D, H: "and upon the family of Muhammad," and in E: "and may Allah bless the family of Muhammad" instead of "and upon his family."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: and his companions (1) and grant them abundant peace. As for what follows: Indeed, the compilations on the terminology (2) of the people of Hadith have become numerous, expanded, and abridged. So some of the brethren (3) asked me to summarize for him (4) the important [aspects] of that. So I answered him to his request, hoping to be included in those paths [of the scholars].
foot_note:
1. "And his companions" is missing from B.
2. In W: "Mustalah" (terminology - synonym).
3. In W: "My brethren."
4. In B, D: "for them"; but the context implies the singular due to the sentences following it.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: So I say: * The Report (Al-Khabar): Either it has paths (1) without (2) a specific number, or with a restriction (3) to more than two, or to two, or to one. So the first: is the Mutawatir (Mass Transmitted), which imparts certain knowledge with its conditions. And the second: is the Mashhur (Famous), which is the Mustafid (Diffused) (4) - according to one opinion. And the third (5): is the Aziz (Rare/Strong), and it is not a condition for the Sahih (Authentic) - contrary to who claimed it. And the fourth: is the Gharib (Strange). And all of them - except the first - are Ahad (Solitary). And among them are the Accepted (Maqbul) and the Rejected (Mardud) (6); because reasoning with them (7) depends on investigating the conditions of their narrators - unlike the first (8). And there may occur within them what imparts theoretical knowledge through contextual indicators - according to the chosen view.
foot_note:
1. In C: "Taraf" (extremities); which is a distortion. In E: "comes from paths" instead of "has paths."
2. In B, W, an addition: "Hasr" (restriction).
3. "Restriction" is missing from W.
4. In B: "and the Mustafid," and in C: "Al-Mustafiz" with the letter Za'. Al-Razi, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Mukhtar al-Sihah under root: F-Y-D (p. 245) -: "Mustafid; meaning: spread among people."
5. In E: "The third."
6. In W: "And within them is the rejected."
7. In C: "Bihima" (with both), and what is established agrees with the author's commentary.
8. "Unlike the first" is missing from B.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then the Strangeness (Gharabah): Either it is (1) in the origin (2) of the chain (Sanad), or not. So the first: is the Absolute Fard (3) (Absolute Solitary). And the second: is the Relative Fard (4) (Relative Solitary), and applying the term "Fardiyyah" (Singularity) to it is rare.
foot_note:
1. In E: "The Gharib: Either it is" instead of "The Strangeness: Either it is."
2. "Origin" is missing from C.
3. In Z: "Al-Mufrad" (The Single).
4. In Z: "Al-Mufrad," and "Al-Fard" is missing from E.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And the Solitary Report (Khabar al-Ahad) transmitted by an upright (Adl) person, with complete precision (Dabt), with a connected (1) chain, neither (2) defective (Mu'allal) nor anomalous (Shadh): is the Sahih (Authentic) in itself (Li-Dhatihi). Its ranks vary (3) according to the variation of these descriptions. Hence, Sahih Al-Bukhari is prioritized, then Muslim (4), then what meets their conditions (5). But if the precision is light (6): then it is the Hasan (Good) in itself (Li-Dhatihi), and with a multitude of paths, it becomes Sahih. If they [Sahih and Hasan] are combined, then it is due to hesitation (8) regarding the transmitter where there is singularity (9), otherwise (10) it is considering two chains.
foot_note:
1. In W: "Muttasil" with Kasrah on Lam and Dammah, not vocalized in the rest of copies, and vocalized with Nasb (Fatha) in one of the Nuzhah copies. Al-Qari, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Sharh Sharh al-Nukhbah (p. 243) -: "With Nasb as a Hal (circumstantial accusative) from (the transmission), for it is an object in meaning as we indicated, or from the subject - which is (the Solitary Report) - according to the view permitting it as is Sibawayh's opinion, and it is said: an adjective; if estimating the connected definite noun is allowed, but most prevented it." See: Qada' al-Watar in Nuzhat al-Nazar (2/664).
2. In W: "Ghayri" with Kasrah on Ra', and what is established is from D.
3. In H: "Yatafawatu" with Ya'.
4. In D: "Muslimun" with Raf' (Nominative), and what is established is from C, W. Al-Qari, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Sharh Sharh Nukhbat al-Fikr (p. 282) -: "With Jarr (Genitive); conjoined to (Al-Bukhari), by omitting the annexed noun - in the text -, and he explicitly mentioned this omitted part in the explanation."
5. In D: "Shurutuhuma" (their conditions - plural). "Then Muslim, then their condition" is missing from E.
6. In E: "If the precision is not complete" instead of "If the precision is light." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "If the precision is light; meaning: less."
7. In B: "Then it is the Hasan."
8. In C: "Fa-li-taraddudin" (so for a hesitation), and in E: "Fa-la taradduda" (then no hesitation).
9. In C: "Al-Tafarrudi" with Jarr, and what is established is from D, W, H.
10. "Otherwise" is missing from Z. The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "Otherwise, if hesitation does not occur."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: And the addition of their narrator (1) is accepted as long as it does not contradict one who is more trustworthy. But if he is opposed by one more preponderant: then the preponderant is the Mahfuz (Preserved); and its opposite is the Shadh (Anomalous). And with weakness (2): the preponderant (3) is the Ma'ruf (Known); and its opposite is the Munkar (Denounced).
foot_note:
1. In E: "Rawatihima" (their narrators), and in Z: "Rawatiha" (its narrators).
2. In B, D: "Al-Da'if" (The weak one).
3. In Z: "Fal-rajih" (So the preponderant) with an added Fa', which is among what the author added in Al-Nuzhah.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: And the Relative Fard (1) (Solitary): If another agrees with him: then it (2) is the Mutabi' (3) (Follow-up). And if a text is found resembling it (4): then it is the Shahid (Witness). And tracking the paths (5) for that: is the I'tibar (Consideration).
foot_note:
1. In E: "And the Mufrad."
2. In B: "Huwa" without Fa'.
3. In Z: "Al-Tabi'" (The Follower); which is an error, and in E: "Al-Mutaba'" with Fatha on Ba', and the established vocalization is from B, D, which agrees with the author's saying in Nuzhat al-Nazar-: "With Kasrah on the unified letter (Ba')."
4. In Z: "Bi-shibhihi" (with its likeness), and in H: "Yushabihuhu" (resembles it).
5. In H: "Al-Turuqu" with Raf'; which is an error.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then the Accepted (Maqbul): If it is free from contradiction: then it is the Muhkam (Decisive). And if it is opposed by its like: then if reconciliation is possible: it is Mukhtalif (1) al-Hadith (Divergent Hadith). Or if the later one is established (2): then it is the Nasikh (Abrogating), and the other is the Mansukh (Abrogated). Otherwise, preference (Tarjih) (3), then suspension (Tawaqquf).
foot_note:
1. In B, D, H: "Mukhtalaf" with Fatha on Lam, and the established is from E. Al-Qari, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Sharh Sharh Nukhbat al-Fikr (p. 363) -: "(Mukhtalif): With Kasrah on Lam; meaning: The indication of its hadith differs, and what matches it corresponds: (then it is the Nasikh). Some vocalized it: with Fatha on Lam; a mim-masdar, and what suits it is his saying later: (then Preference)."
2. In E: "Yathbutu" (is established - verb), and in H: "wa in thabata" (and if it is established). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "If the later one is known and established by it..."
3. In W: "Fa-yurajjahu" (then it is preferred), and in B: "wa illa fa-la" (otherwise no) instead of "Otherwise, preference." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "Then preference if it is determined."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * Then the Rejected (Mardud): Either it is due to an omission (Saqt) (1) or a criticism (Ta'n). So the omission (2): is either (3) from (4) the beginning of the chain from a compiler (5), or from its end after the Tabi'i (Successor), or (6) other than that. So the first: is the Mu'allaq (Hanging). And the second: is the Mursal (Hurried). And the third: if it is by two or more consecutively: then it is the Mu'dal (Problematic), otherwise it is the Munqati' (Broken). Then it may be clear or hidden: So the first: is perceived by the lack of meeting, hence the need for history. And the second: is the Mudallas (Obfuscated), and it comes with a formula implying (7) meeting (8): like "An" (From) and "Qala" (He said). And likewise the Mursal Khafi (Hidden Mursal) from a contemporary who did not meet (9).
foot_note:
1. In B, D: "Li-Saqatin" with Fatha on Qaf, and the correct is Sukun on Qaf, see: Sharh Sharh al-Nukhbah (p. 388) by Al-Qari. In H: "Li-Siqtin" with Kasrah on Sin, and the established is from W.
2. In B, D: "Fal-Saqatu" with Fatha on Qaf.
3. "Imma" (Either) is missing from Z.
4. In W: From his saying: "Fal-Saqt" to here did not appear due to restoration.
5. In Z: "Munsif" (Just/Half); which is a distortion.
6. In B, addition: "Min" (From).
7. In B: "Tahtamilu, Yahtamilu" (she implies, he implies) with Ta' and Ya' together. The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And the Mudallas comes with a formula of performance formulas implying the occurrence of meeting."
8. In E: "Al-Liqa'" (Meeting).
9. In D: "Yulqa" with Damma on Ya', and "from a contemporary who did not meet" is missing from H, and the established is from B.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then the Criticism (Ta'n): Either (1) it is due to the narrator's lying, or his accusation of that, or excessive error, or negligence, or immorality (Fisq), or delusion (Wahm) (2), or opposition, or ignorance (3), or innovation, or poor memory. So the first: is the Mawdu' (Fabricated). And the second: is the Matruk (Abandoned) (4). And the third: is the Munkar (Denounced) - according to one opinion. And likewise the fourth and the fifth. Then the delusion: if it is discovered through contextual indicators and gathering paths: then it is the Mu'allal (Defective) (5).
foot_note:
1. "An" (that) is missing from Z.
2. Note: Al-Laqqani said - in Qada' al-Watar (3/1019) -: "It appears that (Al-Wahm) here: means the mind going to what is intended as something else; not meaning error, nor meaning omission. Otherwise, it would have been necessary to express it as Iham (creating illusion), or repetition would be necessary with the mention of error. Upon contemplating the commentator's saying: 'That he narrates... etc.', intending any of these meanings is not applicable at all; so let it be contemplated seriously."
3. In E, H: "Ignorance of his state," and the established agrees with the author's explanation.
4. In Z: "Al-Matrak"; which is a distortion.
5. In D: "Al-Mu'allali" with Kasrah; which is a mistake.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then the Opposition (Mukhalafah): If it is (1) by changing (2) the context: then it is Mudraj (Interpolated) (3) of the chain. Or by merging (4) a suspended (Mawquf) (5) with a raised (Marfu') one: then it is Mudraj of the text. Or by advancing and delaying (6): then it is the Maqlub (Inverted). Or by adding a narrator: then it is Mazid fi Muttasil al-Asanid (Addition in Connected Chains) (7). Or by replacing him with no preponderator: then it is the Mudtarib (Disordered), and (8) replacement may occur deliberately for testing. Or by changing (9) letters while the script remains: then it is the Musahhaf (Misread) and the Muharraf (Distorted) (10). And it is not permissible to deliberately change (11) the text by reduction or synonym, except for a knowledgeable person (12) regarding what alters (13) meanings. If the meaning is hidden: there is a need for explaining the Strange (Gharib) and clarifying the Problematic (Mushkil) (14).
foot_note:
1. "If it is" is missing from W.
2. In Z: "Bi-Taghayyur" (by change). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "The one in which that change occurs is: Mudraj of the chain."
3. In Z: "Wa Mudraj" (And Mudraj).
4. In H: "Bi-Damjin" with genitive tanween; which is a mistake.
5. In E: "Mawqufan"; which is an error.
6. In W, D: "Or delaying."
7. In E: "Al-Masanid" (The Musnads), and in Z: "Al-Isnad" (The Chain).
8. "And may" is missing from Z.
9. In W: "Taghyiru" without Ba', and in Z: "Bi-Taghayyur." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "Or if the opposition is by changing a letter or letters."
10. In Z: "Fal-Muhraf."
11. In Z: "The change by reduction" instead of "changing the text by reduction," and "changing" is missing from W, and written in its margin: "Perhaps: deliberate changing."
12. In W: "Li-l-Alim" (For the scholar).
13. In H: "Yahilu" with Fatha on Ya'; which is a mistake.
14. In Z, an addition: "Minha" (Of it), and in E: a blank space in its place, and it is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then Ignorance (Jahalah): And its cause is: That the narrator may have many descriptions, so he is mentioned by other than what became famous (1) about him for a purpose, and they compiled the Mudih (Clarifier) regarding it (2). And he (3) may be scarce [in narration] so taking from him is not frequent (4), and they compiled the Wuhdan (Singulars) regarding it (5) (6). Or he is not named (7) for abbreviation, and in it are the Mubhamat (Obscure Ones), and the obscure one is not accepted even if obscured with a word of endorsement (Ta'dil) (8) - according to the most correct view. If he is named (9) and one person (10) is solitary in narrating from him: then he is Majhul al-Ayn (11) (Unknown in Person). Or two (12) or more, and he is not (13) authenticated: then he is Majhul al-Hal (Unknown in Condition), which is the Mastur (Veiled) (14).
foot_note:
1. In B, D, E: "Ma Ishtahara" with Fatha on Ta' and Ha', not vocalized in other copies.
2. From his saying: "His descriptions may be many so he is mentioned..." to here is missing from C.
3. In C: "Qad" without Waw.
4. In W: "Fa-la yukthiru" with Damma on Ya' and Kasra on Tha', and the established is from D.
5. In C, D, E: "Wa fihi" instead of "Wa sannafu fihi." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And they compiled the Wuhdan regarding it."
6. In Z: "Al-Wahidan."
7. In E: "Or not and is named." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "Or the narrator is not named - for abbreviation - by the one narrating from him."
8. In W: "Ta'dil" (Endorsement).
9. In Z, an addition: "Rawin" (a narrator); which is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar with the wording: "Al-Rawi."
10. In C: "Wa Akhadha" (And took); which is a distortion, and in B: "Rawin" (a narrator) instead of "Wahidun" (one), and in a copy in its margin: "Wahid," and the established vocalization is from D, E, W. The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And one narrator is solitary in narrating."
11. "Al-Ayn" is missing from B.
12. In E: "Wa Ithnan" (And two). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "Or if two or more narrate from him."
13. In H: "Aw lam" (Or not).
14. "Wa huwa al-Mastur" is missing from B.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then Innovation (Bid'ah): Either (1) causing disbelief (2), or causing immorality (3). So the first: The majority (5) do not accept its holder (4). And the second: One who is not a caller is accepted (6) - in the most correct view -, unless he narrates (7) what strengthens his innovation, then he is rejected - according to the chosen view -, and Al-Juzajani (8) - the Sheikh of Al-Nasa'i - stated this explicitly.
foot_note:
1. In B, an addition: "An takuna" (To be).
2. In E, Z: "Bi-Kufrin" (With disbelief).
3. In E: "Aw Bi-Fisqin" (Or with immorality).
4. In B: "La yaqbaluhu" (Does not accept him) instead of "La yaqbalu sahibaha."
5. In Z: "Al-Majhul" (The unknown); which is a distortion, and in B an addition: "Wa qila: yuqbal" (And it is said: he is accepted).
6. In H: "Ma" (What).
7. In B, W: "Yarwi" (He narrates).
8. In D: "Al-Jawzajani" with Fatha on Jim, and the established is from H. Ibn Raslan, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Sharh Sunan Abi Dawud (12/372) -: "(Al-Juzajani) with Damma on the first Jim, and Fatha on Zay and the lightened Jim, and after the Alif is Nun; ascribed to a city in Khurasan next to Balkh; called: Juzajan." See: Sharh Sharh al-Nukhbah by Al-Qari (p. 531).

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then Poor Memory: If it is inherent, then it is the Shadh (Anomalous) - according to one opinion -, or emerging, then it is the Mukhtalit (Mixed up) (1). And whenever (2) the Poor of Memory is followed up by a considerable [narration] (4) - and likewise the Mastur (Veiled) (5), the Mursal, and the Mudallas -: their hadith becomes Hasan (Good); not in itself, but by the aggregate.
foot_note:
1. In E: "Al-Mukhtalif" (The Different); which is a distortion, and in B, D: "Al-Mukhtalat" with Fatha on Lam, and the established vocalization is from W. The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "So this is the Mukhtalit."
2. In E: "Wa idha" (And if).
3. In D: "Sayyi'" (Bad).
4. In E: "Fa-Mu'tabar" (Then considerable). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And whenever the Poor of Memory is followed up by a considerable - such as being above him or like him, not below him... -."
5. In E: "Al-Mashhur" (The Famous), and in B: "And likewise the Mukhtalit and the Mastur" instead of "And likewise the Mastur."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * Then the Chain of Transmission (Isnad): Either it ends to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, explicitly, or by ruling (1): from his saying (2), or his action, or his approval. Or to the Companion likewise, and he is: whoever met the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him (3), believing in him and died on Islam - even if apostasy intervened in (4) the most correct view (5). Or to the Tabi'i (Successor), and he is: whoever met the Companion likewise. So the first (6): is the Marfu' (Raised). And the second: is the Mawquf (Suspended) (8). And the third: is the Maqtu' (Cut) - and whoever (9) is below the Tabi'i (10) in it: is like him. And the last two are called: The Athar (Trace) (11).
foot_note:
1. In E: "Kinayah" (Metonymy). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And an example of the Marfu' from speech by ruling, not explicitly."
2. In A, Z, an addition: "Peace and blessings be upon him," and "from his saying" is missing from E.
3. "The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him" is missing from Z.
4. In W, H: "Ala" (Upon/In).
5. "In the most correct view" is missing from E.
6. In B: "And the first," and "So the first" is missing from Z.
7. In E: "Marfu'."
8. In E: "Mawquf."
9. In H: "Min" with Kasrah on Mim; which is a mistake.
10. In C: "The Companion." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And whoever is below the Tabi'i - from the followers of the Tabi'in and those after them -."
11. "And the last two are called: The Athar" is missing from Z.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And the Musnad (Connected): is the Marfu' of a Companion with a chain whose appearance is continuity. If its number [of narrators] is few: then either it ends (1) to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, or to an Imam with a lofty characteristic like "Shu'bah". So the first: is the Absolute Elevation (Uluww Mutlaq). And the second: is the Relative Elevation (2) (Uluww Nisbi). In it is Muwafaqah (Agreement); which is (3): Reaching the Sheikh of one of the compilers from other than his path. And Badal (Substitute) (4); which is: Reaching the Sheikh of his Sheikh likewise (5). And Musawah (Equality) (6); which is: The equality of the number (7) of the chain (8) from the narrator to its end, with the chain of one of the compilers. And Musafahah (Handshaking) (9); which is: Equality with the student of that compiler. And Elevation with its types (10) corresponds to: Descent (Nuzul).
foot_note:
1. In E, H: "Yakunu" (Is), and in the author's explanation: "Yantahi" (Ends).
2. "Elevation" is missing from B, Z.
3. In E: "Wa huwa" (And it is).
4. In B, Z, H: "Wa fihi al-Badal" (And in it is Badal), which is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar, and likewise the next two places.
5. "Likewise" is missing from W.
6. In B, Z: "Wa fihi al-Musawah."
7. In C: "Adadu" with Damma on Dal; which is an error; because it is genitive construct.
8. In C: "Al-Isnadayn" (The two chains), in W: "Al-Asanid" (The chains), and in Nuzhat al-Nazar: "Al-Isnad."
9. In B, Z: "Wa fihi al-Musafahah."
10. In Z: "Bi-Aqsam" (With types). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And Elevation with its mentioned types corresponds to."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: If the narrator and the one he narrates from share in age and meeting (1), it is: Al-Aqran (2) (Peers). If each of them narrates from the other: it is Al-Mudabbaj (3) (Mutual). And if he narrates (4) from one (5) below him: then it is Seniors from Juniors (Al-Akabir 'an Al-Asaghir), and of it (6): Fathers from Sons; and in its reverse is abundance (7), and of it (8): Who narrates from his father from his grandfather (9). And if (10) two share in a Sheikh, and the death of one of them precedes; then it is: The Former and the Later (Al-Sabiq wa Al-Lahiq). And if he narrates from two agreeing in name, and they are not distinguished (11): then by his specifying (12) one of them, the Neglected (13) (Muhmal) becomes clear.
foot_note:
1. In C: "Aw Al-Luqi" (Or meeting), in D, W, H: "Aw fi Al-Luqi" (Or in meeting), and in E: "Aw fi Al-Liqa'" (Or in meeting). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And Al-Luqi: It is taking from Sheikhs."
2. In E: "Al-Iqrar" (Confession); which is a distortion. The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "So it is the type called: Narration of Peers; because then he narrates from his peer."
3. In W: "Fa-huwa Al-Mudabbaj" (Then it is Al-Mudabbaj).
4. "Narrates" is missing from Z.
5. In W, an addition: "Huwa" (He).
6. In B: "Wa fihi" (And in it).
7. In H: "Kathirah" (Many); which is an error.
8. In E: "Wa minhum" (And of them); which is an error.
9. "And of it: Who narrates from his father from his grandfather" is missing from Z.
10. In E: "Fa-in" (So if).
11. In W: "Yumayyaza" (Are distinguished), and "and they are not distinguished" is missing from B.
12. In Z: "Fa-bi-inkhifadihi" (Then by his lowering); which is an error.
13. In Z: "Bi-tabayyun" (By clarification); which is a distortion.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: And if the Sheikh denies what he narrated decisively: it is rejected, or possibly (1): it is accepted - in the most correct view -, and in it: is one who narrated and forgot. And if the narrators agree (2) in the formulas of performance, or other than that of states (3); then it is Al-Musalsal (Patterned/Chained).
foot_note:
1. In D: "Wah-timalan" (And possibly).
2. In B: "Ittafaqat" (Agreed - feminine).
3. In H: "Al-Ahwal" (Conditions).

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And the Formulas of Performance (1): "Sami'tu" (I heard) and "Haddathani" (He narrated to me), then "Akhbarani" (He informed me), and "Qara'tu 'alayhi" (I read to him), then "Quri'a 'alayhi wa ana asma'u" (It was read to him while I was listening), then "Anba'ani" (He informed me), then "Nawalani" (He handed to me), then "Shafahani" (He told me verbally), then "Kataba ilayya" (He wrote to me), then "An" (From) and its like. So the first two: are for one who heard alone from the wording of the Sheikh, and if gathered then with others (2). And the first of them: is the most explicit (3) and highest in dictation. And the third and fourth: are for one who read himself. And if gathered: then it is like the fifth (4). And Al-Inba' (5): is in the meaning of Al-Ikhbar (6), except in the convention of the later scholars; so it (7) is for Ijazah (License) (8) like "An". And the 'an'anah (saying "from") of a contemporary is carried (9) upon hearing except from a Mudallis (10), and it is said: proof of their meeting (11) is conditional even if once (12) - and it is the chosen view -.
foot_note:
1. In D: "Al-Ada'" with Madd.
2. In E: "Jama'ah" (Group) instead of "others." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "(If gathered) The narrator, meaning: ... then it is proof that he heard from him with others, and the Nun may be for grandeur but rarely."
3. In E: "Asrah" (More explicit).
4. In W: "Al-Khamis" (The fifth).
5. In E: "Al-Inba'" with Raf' and Jarr; and Jarr is an error, and the established is from D.
6. In D: "And Al-Inba' is like Al-Ikhbar" instead of "And Al-Inba': is in the meaning of Al-Ikhbar."
7. In Z: "Fa-innahu" (Then it is).
8. In E, W: "Al-Ijazah."
9. In C: "Mahmul" (Carried - masculine).
10. In W: "Mudallis," and in E: "Al-Mudallas" with Fatha on Lam, and the established vocalization is from B, D, W.
11. In Z: "Liqa'iha" (Her meeting). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "Their meeting; meaning: The Sheikh, and the narrator from him."
12. In W: "Marratun" with Raf', and the established is from C, D.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: And they applied Al-Mushafahah (Verbal communication) (1) to the verbally uttered Ijazah, and Al-Mukatabah (Correspondence) to the written Ijazah (2). And they stipulated for the validity of Al-Munawalah (Handing over): its coupling with permission to narrate - and it is the highest type of Ijazah. And likewise they stipulated: permission (3) in Wijadah (Finding), Wasiyyah (Bequest) of the book (4), and I'lam (Notification) (5), otherwise there is no consideration for that - like the General Ijazah, and for the Unknown (6) and the Non-existent (7) - according to the most correct view in all of that.
foot_note:
1. In E: "Al-Mushafihah" with Kasra on Fa'; which is a mistake.
2. In W: "Wal-Ijazah" instead of "Fi Al-Ijazah"; which is an error.
3. "Permission" is missing from W.
4. In E: "Bil-Kutub" (Of books).
5. In H: "Wa fi Al-I'lam" (And in notification).
6. In D, E, W, Z: "Wal-Majhul." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And likewise Ijazah for the unknown."
7. In B, H: "Wa lil-Ma'dum," and the addition of the preposition Lam is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * Then the Narrators, if their names agree, and the names of their fathers upwards (1), and their persons differ: then it is Al-Muttafiq wa Al-Muftariq (Agreed and Separated). And if (2) the names agree in writing, and differ in pronunciation: then it is Al-Mu'talif wa Al-Mukhtalif (Consonant and Different). And if the names agree and the fathers differ (3), or vice versa: then it is Al-Mutashabih (Similiar) (4), and likewise if that (5) agreement occurs in the name and the father's name (6), and difference in the affiliation (Nisbah) (7). And types are composed (8) from it and from what is before it; among them: that agreement or similarity (9) happens, except in a letter or two letters, or by advancing and delaying (10), and the like (11) of that.
foot_note:
1. "Upwards" is missing from E, H.
2. In B: "Fa-in" (So if).
3. In Z: "Ikhtalafa" (Differed - singular).
4. In C: "Al-Mushabih"; which is a distortion.
5. "That" is missing from H.
6. In C, D: "Ismin wa ismi abin" instead of "Fi al-ismi wa ismi al-abi."
7. "And likewise if that agreement occurs in the name and the father's name, and difference in the affiliation" is missing from B, Z.
8. In C, D, Z: "Wa yurakkabu" (And composed). The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And composed from it."
9. In E: "Wal-Ishtibah."
10. In B, E, W: "Aw al-Ta'khir" (Or delaying).
11. In W, Z: "Aw Nahwu" (Or like).

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Conclusion (1) * And of the important matters: Knowing the classes (Tabaqat) of narrators, their birth dates, their death dates (2), their lands, and their conditions - in terms of endorsement (Ta'dil), disparagement (Tajrih), and ignorance (Jahalah). And the Ranks of Disparagement (3): And the worst of them: Description with the elative form (Af'al) (4); like "Akdhab al-Nas" (The most lying of people) (5), then "Dajjal" (Imposter), or "Wadda'" (Fabricator), or "Kadhdhab" (Liar) (6). And the easiest of them: "Layyin" (Soft/Lenient), or "Sayyi' al-Hifz" (Poor of memory), or "Fihi adna (7) Maqal" (8) (In him is the slightest speech). And the Ranks (9) of Endorsement: And the highest of them: Description with the elative form; like "Awthaq (10) al-Nas" (The most trustworthy of people) (11).
foot_note:
1. "Conclusion" is missing from H, and in its place is a blank space.
2. In E: "Wa wafatihim," and in B: "Knowing the layers of Muhaddithin and their clients and tribes" instead of "Knowing the classes of narrators, their birth dates, and their death dates."
3. Up to here ends the lacuna in A.
4. In E: "What implies exaggeration" instead of "Description with the elative form." The author, may Allah have mercy on him, said in Nuzhat al-Nazar -: "And the worst of them: Description with what indicates exaggeration."
5. In E: "Kadhib al-Nas," and in D: "Ka-Akdhaba al-Nasi" with Nasb; which is an error.
6. In E: "Then what is emphasized like Kadhdhab Dajjal then this without emphasis" instead of "then Dajjal, or Wadda', or Kadhdhab," and the author did not mention it in Nuzhat al-Nazar.
7. In W: "Aw wa adna" instead of "Aw fihi adna," and in Z: "Wa fihi adna," and "Adna" is missing from H.
8. In E: "Maqalun" with Raf' Tanween, and the established vocalization is from A, C, D, W.
9. In W: "Wa Maratibu" with Raf', and the established is from A, D.
10. In D: "Awthaqa" with Jarr and Nasb, and the established is from A, W.
11. In E: "And the highest of them is what implies exaggeration: like Adyan al-Nas (The most religious of people)" instead of "And the highest of them: Description with the elative form: like Awthaq al-Nas," and the author did not mention it in Nuzhat al-Nazar.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: Then what is emphasized (1) with an attribute (2) or two attributes (3) like "Thiqah Thiqah" (Trustworthy Trustworthy), or "Thiqah Hafiz" (Trustworthy Memorizer) (4). And the lowest of them: What indicates proximity to the easiest disparagement; like "Sheikh" (A Sheikh). And Tazkiyah (Vouching) is accepted from one knowledgeable of its causes, even from one person - in (5) the most correct view -. And Disparagement takes precedence over Endorsement if it is issued explained (6) from one knowledgeable of its causes. If it is devoid of endorsement, it is accepted (7) summarily - according to the chosen view -.
foot_note:
1. In E: "Wa ma ta'akkada," and in W: "Thumma ta'akkudun" instead of "Thumma ma ta'akkada," and the established agrees with Nuzhat al-Nazar.
2. In C: "Bi-sifati" with one Kasra; which is a mistake, and the established is from D, W.
3. "With an attribute or two attributes" is missing from E.
4. In E: "Like Thiqah Hafiz, or Thiqah Thiqah" with advancing and delaying.
5. "Ala" (In) is missing from B, and in its place is a blank space.
6. In H: "Mubayyinan" with Kasrah on Ya', and "Mubayyanan" is missing from E, Z, and the established is from B, W.
7. "Qubila" (Accepted) is missing from Z.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And knowing the Kunyas of those named (1), and the names of those known by Kunyas (2). And whose name is his Kunya. And whose Kunyas or descriptions are many. And whose Kunya agrees with his father's name, or vice versa (3), or his Kunya (4) is his wife's Kunya. And who is attributed to other than his father (5), or (6) to (7) other than what races to (8) the understanding (9). And whose name and his father's and grandfather's name agree (10) (11), or and the name (12) of his Sheikh and his Sheikh's Sheikh upwards. And whose Sheikh's name and the narrator from him agree.
foot_note:
1. In C: "Al-Musammiyin" with two Yas, and in E, Z: "Al-Muslimin"; which is a distortion, and in D: "Al-Musammin" with Kasrah on the second Mim, and the established is from A, W.
2. In C, E: "Al-Mukanniyin" with two Yas, and in B: "Al-Maknin" with Fatha on Mim, Sukun on Kaf, and Kasrah on Nun, and the established is from A, D, W.
3. In C, E: "Al-Aks."
4. "Kunyathu" is missing from A.
5. In B, Z, an addition: "Like Al-Miqdad Ibn Al-Aswad," which is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar.
6. In A, an addition: "Nusiba."
7. "Ila" is missing from D.
8. "Ila" is missing from A.
9. In B, an addition: "Like Al-Hadhdha'," and in C, D, E, W: "Lil-fahm."
10. In Z: "Wafaqa," and the established agrees with what is in Nuzhat al-Nazar.
11. "Wa jaddihi" is missing from B.
12. In B, W: "Ism."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And knowing the Abstract and Singular Names (1), and likewise the Kunyas, Titles (Alqab), and Affiliations (Ansab) (2). And they occur (3) to tribes, and homelands - lands (4), or estates (5) and alleys (6), and neighborhood (7) -. And to crafts and trades. And Agreement and Similarity (9) occur in them (8) like names. And they may occur (10) as Titles. And knowing the reasons for that.
foot_note:
1. In H: "Al-Mufarradah" with Tashdid on Ra'; which is an error.
2. In Z: "Wal-Intisab."
3. In W, H: "Wa yaqa'u" with Ya'.
4. "Biladan" is missing from B.
5. In A, C, E: "Wa diya'an" with Waw of conjunction, and in W: "Diya'an."
6. In Z, H: "Aw sikakan," and the addition of Hamza is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar.
7. In Z, H: "Aw mujawaratan," and the addition of Hamza is from within Nuzhat al-Nazar.
8. In H: "Fihi," and in D: "Minha."
9. In A, C, D, E, W: "Al-Ishtibah wa Al-Ittifaq" with advancing and delaying, and the established agrees with what is in Nuzhat al-Nazar.
10. In W, Z, H: "Yaqa'u" with Ya', and in B, Z, an addition: "Al-Ansab."

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And knowing the Mawali (1) from above, and from below (2), by slavery, or by alliance (3). * And knowing the Brothers and Sisters.
foot_note:
1. In E: "Al-Mawla."
2. In Z, H: "Wa asfala" without "Min," which is among what the author deleted from Nuzhat al-Nazar.
3. In B, D: "Aw bil-Halifi" with Fatha on Ha' and Kasra on Lam, and in H: "Bil-Khalf"; which is a distortion, and in B an addition: "Or by Islam," and the established is from A, E, W.

book_title: Nukhbat al-Fikr fi Mustalah Ahl al-Athar
text: * And knowing the Etiquettes (1) of the Sheikh and the Student. And the age (2) of bearing (Tahammul) (3) and performance (Ada') (4). And the manner (5) of writing Hadith (6), its presentation, its hearing, and its recitation, and traveling (7) for it (8). And its compilation according to Musnads (9), or Chapters (10), or Defects (Ilal), or Peripheral Chains (Atraf) (11).
foot_note:
1. In A, C, E, H: "Adab."
2. In A, C, D, E: "Wa waqta sinni" instead of "Wa sinni," and in Z: "Wa sunan"; which is a distortion.
